alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 7:53PM MDT until August 06 at 9:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN EL PASO COUNTY... At 753 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have moved out of the warned area. However, with reports of 3 inches of rainfall measured across northeastern El Paso County, flash flooding is likely occuring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ramah and open country of northeastern El Paso County. This includes the following streams and drainages... Antelope Creek, Horse Creek, North Fork Horse Creek, Big Sandy Creek and Mustang Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
